title: Trump Team Bets Impeachment Will Backfire on Democrats
summary: Releasing record of call with Ukrainian president is part of a strategy to convert controversy into advantage. WASHINGTON-Faced with the prospect of impeachment, President Trump and his re-election campaign expressed confidence the effort to boot him from office would give an unlikely boost to his bid for a second term.

title: The Ukraine Transcript Fizzle
summary: The phone call evidence isn't enough to annul a presidential election.. The White House on Wednesday released the transcript of President Trump's July call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, and the news is that Mr. Trump was telling the truth about it. The conversation was largely routine diplomacy, and even the reference to Joe Biden was less than promoted by the press. Good luck persuading Americans that this is an impeachable offense.

title: Trump's Japanese Trade Judo
summary: Repairing damage after U.S. withdrawal from the Pacific pact.. President Trump on Wednesday announced a slimmed-down trade deal with Japan that makes up for some of the self-inflicted damage from pulling out of the Trans-Pacific Partnership two years ago. If he wants more trade wins, he needs to stop scoring in his own goal.

title: Netanyahu Holds On
summary: Three lessons from Israel's stalemated politics.. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has been counted out of politics many times in his long career, including after last week's election saw his center-right coalition fail to win the necessary 61-seat parliamentary majority. On Wednesday he was granted a mandate to form a government, though what happens next is anyone's guess.

title: An Apolitical Supreme Court
summary: Chief Justice John Roberts defends the unpredictable Justices.. Disappointed partisans say the Supreme Court is a political body, with five conservative Justices gleefully voting one way, and four liberals wistfully dissenting. Balderdash, replies Chief Justice John Roberts-to paraphrase him slightly.

title: Some Lawmakers Get Look at Whistleblower Complaint
summary: Democrats described document as credible and alarming. WASHINGTON-Lawmakers on the House and Senate intelligence committees Wednesday got their first look at the whistleblower complaint that further raised concerns about President Trump's July call with his Ukrainian counterpart, as Democrats continue collecting information for their impeachment inquiry.

title: Chicago Shouldn't Declare Opioid Victory
summary: Rahm Emanuel writes about how he sued unpopular companies, levied taxes and imposed fines-all without providing a shred of evidence that this accomplished anything other than filling Chicago's coffers.. When I first saw Rahm Emanuel's "How Chicago Tackled the Opioid Crisis" (op-ed, Sept. 20), I naively assumed I would be reading about a thoughtful model for tackling the country's growing drug crisis. Then I read the former Chicago mayor's account of how he sued unpopular companies, levied taxes and imposed fines-all without providing a shred of evidence that this accomplished anything other than filling Chicago's coffers. Mr. Emanuel moves on to somehow tie this to vaping, again describing his pioneering efforts not to help consumers understand risks, but to tax, regulate and sue vaping companies. This is all nothing more than pandering to those who never liked these industries to begin with and a refusal to offer any real results. We are simply told that Chicago's bad opioid crisis would be worse if these financial burdens had not been imposed, a statement that has the benefit of sounding reasonable while being neither provable nor disputable.

title: Serve the Gifted Poor Students, Not Ideology
summary: The elimination of gifted and talented programs will achieve the exact opposite of the supposed diversity and inclusion goals.. New York Mayor Bill de Blasio should read Jason Riley's "Not All Gifted Children Are From Affluent Families" (Upward Mobility, Sept. 18) and then look every non-affluent New York City parent in the eye while explaining how implementing the recommendations of his school diversity panel to eliminate all gifted programs serves their children.

title: What Are Colleges Doing to Cut Their Students' Costs?
summary: Donors to colleges should tie their contributions to efforts by their school's administrators to limit cost increases to the rate of inflation or, preferably, less.. Regarding your editorial "Thank You, Big Business" (Sept. 20): The generosity of these donors illustrates the private sector's effort to make colleges and professional schools affordable. Although the editorial recognizes that "federal subsidies have inflated college prices," so do private contributions for scholarships.

title: Impeachment Is What Vladimir Putin Wants
summary: Support for Ukraine has always been bipartisan. Russia seeks to undermine it and to divide Americans.. This article is signed by Rep. Michael McCaul (R., Texas), ranking member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, and 18 other Republican members of the committee.

title: Trump and Zelensky
summary: The transcript as provided by the White House.. Trump: Congratulations on a great victory. We all watched from the United States and you did a terrific job. The way you came from behind, somebody who wasn't given much of a chance, and you ended up winning easily. It's a fantastic achievement. Congratulations.

title: Trump Can Do Even More on Iran
summary: The U.S. has the legal authority to reimpose international sanctions unilaterally.. The effectiveness of the Trump administration's sanctions strategy against Iran has been astonishing-doubly so because the "maximum pressure" policy has faced wide opposition, including from close U.S. allies. Most foreign companies have decided to avoid doing business with Iran rather than face potential U.S. secondary sanctions, and this week Britain, France and Germany joined in blaming Tehran for the recent missile attack on Saudi Arabia.

title: Latino Workers Save America From Stagnation
summary: They're the youngest U.S. ethnic cohort, growing at six times the rate of the total population.. A startling fact: If the U.S. Latino population were an independent economy, its gross domestic product would be the fastest-growing among the world's developed economies. U.S. Latino GDP is now $2.3 trillion, as detailed in a new report that estimates the group's economic output by measuring their share across 71 industries. The task for U.S. policy makers is to allow this trend to continue strengthening the country at large.

title: 'On the Plain of Snakes' Review: Why María Left Oaxaca
summary: After a visit to the Mexican border, Paul Theroux resolved to return by car and ﬁnd out why so many risk crossing furtively into the U.S.. A couple of years ago, the novelist and travel writer Paul Theroux visited the U.S.-Mexico border. South of the line he interviewed several people at a shelter serving migrants and deportees, and his memory of an encounter with a woman named María stalked him thereafter "like an apparition." She wept as she told Mr. Theroux how she had left her three young children with their grandmother in Oaxaca, deep in the Mexican interior, so that she could find menial work at a hotel in the United States. But she had lost her way in the desert and was arrested, abused and deported. "Later I saw her alone," he writes, "praying before she ate, an iconic image of piety and hope." He resolved to come back and travel to María's home region by car in order to find out why she and so many others risk crossing furtively into the U.S. "On the Plain of Snakes" is the fierce and poignant account of his monthslong quest.

title: Hong Kong May Topple Communism
summary: A constant of Chinese history is that regimes begin to disintegrate along the periphery.. As Hong Kong entered the 16th straight week of unrest, protesters adopted origami cranes as symbols of resistance, sang their new anthem, burned the Chinese national flag, erected barricades, threw petrol bombs and beat opponents unconscious. The protest movement in the semiautonomous region now has taken on characteristics of an insurgency as people across Hong Kong society vigorously challenge local authorities.

title: The Senate Takes On Campus Censorship
summary: Students' demand for 'safety' from 'harm' has begun eating away at academic freedom.. Universities have long been centers of political correctness. But campus administrations increasingly seem to be indulging students who, when faced with uncomfortable ideas, complain of feeling "harmed" or "unsafe." This is reaching its breaking point and making it hard for professors to teach.

title: Trump's Fight With the 'Globalists'
summary: The bigger threat to independent and sovereign people may be coming from inside their own democratic governments.. President Trump at the United Nations this week elaborated on his long-running antagonism toward globalism. "The future does not belong to globalists," Mr. Trump said. "The future belongs to patriots. The future belongs to sovereign and independent nations who protect their citizens, respect their neighbors, and honor the differences that make each country special and unique."

title: Pelosi's Circular Firing Squad
summary: Impeachment won't get rid of Trump, and it will cost some Democratic seats.. Speaker Nancy Pelosi's announcement that the House will formally consider President Trump's impeachment has plunged America into a constitutional crisis.

title: Impeachment Move Focuses House's Trump Probes
summary: Launch of official inquiry gives Democrats' existing investigations a place to funnel their work. WASHINGTON-When House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) said the Democratic-led chamber would officially begin an impeachment effort aimed at President Trump, she broke with precedent: Every previous impeachment proceeding targeting a president has begun with a House-wide vote to open an inquiry into wrongdoing.

title: New York Media Valued at About $105 Million in Vox Deal
summary: Deal would give New York about 12% of combined company. Vox Media's acquisition of New York Media values the New York magazine-parent at about $105 million, according to people familiar with the situation, and is aimed at creating a more well-rounded player in digital media.

title: Lowe's Goes DIY on Software Development
summary: Home-improvement retailer is spending more on technology to help tailor its e-commerce platform to different customers and boost sales. Lowe's Cos. is taking more of a do-it-yourself approach to software development, retooling its e-commerce platform to boost sales.

title: U.S., Honduras Sign Accord on Asylum Seekers
summary: Pact is latest the U.S. has struck with Latin American nations to curtail border crossings. The Trump administration and the government of Honduras signed an agreement allowing the U.S. to send some asylum seekers from third countries to Honduras, capping a string of deals struck with Latin American nations to stem the flow of migrants crossing the border.

title: New York Attorney General, Brooklyn District Attorney Sue ICE Over Courthouse Arrests
summary: Lawsuit argues that ICE actions disrupt state court operations by scaring away witnesses and complainants. New York Attorney General Letitia James, Brooklyn District Attorney Eric Gonzalez and advocacy groups filed a pair of lawsuits in New York on Wednesday to prevent federal Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers from arresting illegal immigrants who appear in New York courts on unrelated matters.

title: Another Pelosi Reality Check
summary: Investors still don't buy the theory that Trump is a dire threat to the American republic.. On Wednesday markets brought another reality check to Washington's chronic impeachment enthusiasm. In a recurring drama of the Trump era, the Speaker of the House and other Democrats are talking gravely and vaguely about a President allegedly betraying his country and trashing its laws. Meanwhile the massive bipartisan global coalition of equity investors who actually have to put money behind their opinions aren't buying the Pelosi thesis of American crisis.

title: Nike Shares Hit an All-Time High
summary: Footwear and apparel company posts better-than-expected sales, bolstered by China. Shares of Nike Inc. set at an all-time high on Wednesday as the footwear and apparel company reported better-than-expected sales for its latest quarter, driven by China.

title: American Airlines, Latam Airlines Sued Over Seized Cuban Airport
summary: Suit is the latest to come after U.S. lifted its suspension of a provision of the 1996 Helms-Burton Act in May. A U.S. citizen sued two airline companies in a U.S. federal court under a newly revived provision that permits legal action by U.S. citizens or entities against companies doing business on property that was confiscated by the Cuban government.

title: Interim CEO Role Gives eBay Finance Chief Chance to Try Out for Top Role
summary: As interim CEO, eBay's CFO can make a pitch for the role of permanent chief executive. EBay Inc. Chief Financial Officer Scott Schenkel on Wednesday was handed the e-commerce company's top job-on an interim basis. Now, the company veteran has the opportunity to audition for the role of permanent chief executive.

title: U.S., Japan Sign Trade Deal on Farm Goods, Digital Trade
summary: Limited accord Trump, Abe signed on sidelines of United Nations General Assembly will lower agricultural tariffs in Japan, industrial tariffs in the U.S.. President Trump and Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe signed a trade-enhancement agreement that will lower agricultural tariffs in Japan, industrial tariffs in the U.S. and set new rules for digital trade between the world's first- and third-largest economies.

title: His White House Run Over, Mayor de Blasio Has Big Plans at Home
summary: Democratic leader meets with staff to reiterate commitment to goals, including expansion of free preschool for 3-year-olds and continued reduction in crime. Days after dropping out of the presidential race, New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio huddled with dozens of City Hall staffers for a pep rally of sorts to remind them that he still had more than two years left in office.

title: Houston Billionaire to Buy Del Frisco's Restaurant Chains From Private-Equity Firm
summary: Landry's will pay between $300 million and $325 million for Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse and Del Frisco's Grille. A private-equity investor has agreed to sell two Del Frisco's restaurant chains to Landry's Inc., the restaurant company owned by billionaire Tilman Fertitta, owner of the National Basketball Association's Houston Rockets.

title: Arby's Parent to Acquire Jimmy John's
summary: Inspire Brands adds to a stable of restaurants that also includes Sonic, Buffalo Wild Wings. Inspire Brands Inc. is acquiring Jimmy John's Gourmet Sandwiches, the private-equity-backed firm's latest addition to its stable of restaurant chains.

title: States Sue to Undo Changes to Endangered Species Act
summary: 'We're coming out swinging to defend this consequential law'. WASHINGTON-California and more than a dozen other states sued the Trump administration on Wednesday over regulations that they say have illegally weakened the federal law designed to save wildlife from extinction.

title: House Passes Bill to Protect Banking for Marijuana Businesses
summary: Measure would prevent federal regulators from penalizing institutions that serve companies operating in states where cannabis is legal. The House of Representatives passed legislation Wednesday to protect financial institutions that serve marijuana businesses in states where the substance is legal.

title: Dollar's Rally Shows Faith in U.S. Growth
summary: Index tracking the U.S. currency has largest one-day climb since October 2018. The U.S. dollar rose to a three-week high Wednesday, illustrating investors' faith that domestic economic growth will continue outpacing the rest of the world despite increasing political uncertainty.

title: U.S. Sanctions Chinese Firms for Allegedly Shipping Iranian Oil
summary: Trump administration, facing tensions with Tehran, targets Cosco tankers. The Trump administration blacklisted several Chinese companies including units of a state giant for allegedly shipping Iranian oil in violation of U.S. sanctions, attempting to cut off the last vestiges of Iran's crude exports.

title: New York, Seneca Nation End Feud Over Stretch of Highway
summary: The Senecas sold the state a permanent easement for the highway in 1954, but years later sued, saying it was invalid.. The Seneca Nation of Indians reached an agreement Wednesday that will let the New York State Thruway Authority perform needed maintenance on a stretch of highway that runs across a Seneca reservation in Western New York.

title: SoftBank-Backed Real Estate Broker Compass Hit by High-Level Exits
summary: Startup fueled by investment from Japanese tech fund faces scrutiny following wave of executive departures. As We Cos. tries to regroup after its CEO's abrupt departure, another real-estate tech company backed by SoftBank Group Corp. is contending with an exodus of top executives.

title: During Last Impeachment Proceedings, Investors Stuck With Hot Stocks
summary: Six of top 10 performing stocks during President Clinton's trial were tech stocks. It might be time for investors to start thinking about their impeachment strategies.

title: 'All Mirrors' by Angel Olsen: A Surprising Turn
summary: Instead of aiming for mainstream popularity following earlier successes, the indie artist has delivered a challenging and intense art-pop offering unconcerned with trends..

title: Germany's Lautenschläger Resigns From ECB Board
summary: Official's planned departure in October will come two years before term ends. FRANKFURT-The most senior German official at the European Central Bank unexpectedly resigned before the end of her term amid a conflict over a move this month to restart the bank's giant bond-buying program.

title: Best Buy Aims to Cut $1 Billion in Costs by 2025
summary: Electronics retailer plans to generate $50 billion in annual enterprise revenue within next five years. Best Buy Co. said it plans to hit $50 billion in annual revenue by 2025 and cut about $1 billion in costs in the next five years.

title: Big Volatility Wagers Hit Markets
summary: Some investors are positioning themselves for bigger swings in the market. As U.S. stocks logged one of the most volatile days in recent weeks Tuesday, some investors positioned for bigger swings.

title: Elliott Management Renews Push to Split Up Marathon Petroleum
summary: Activist investor urges three-way breakup: separating Speedway gas-station chain and pipeline operations, but leaving refining business. Hedge fund Elliott Management Corp. sent a letter to Marathon Petroleum Corp.'s board Wednesday proposing again that the fuel maker split into three different companies.

title: Egyptian Forces Arrest 1,400 People After Anti-Sisi Protests
summary: Crackdown is one of the largest on political opponents in years, rights groups say. CAIRO-Egypt's security forces have arrested some 1,400 people in recent days in one of the largest crackdowns on political opponents in years, rights groups said, amid protests calling for President Abdel Fattah Al Sisi's removal.

title: 'Bertoldo di Giovanni: The Renaissance of Sculpture in Medici Florence' Review: Out of the Shadows
summary: An exhibition highlights the work of the underappreciated 15th-century sculptor-and teacher of Michelangelo-who advanced both the art of his time and the agenda of his patrons, the Medici family.. New York

title: New York Fed Boosts Size of Repurchase Operations
summary: Overnight loans rise to $100 billion from $75 billion. The Federal Reserve Bank of New York said Wednesday it would increase the size of scheduled operations to provide short-term cash loans to financial firms.

title: U.S. Stocks Climb on Hopes for Trade Deal
summary: Nike closes at an all-time high, lifting the Dow industrials. U.S. stocks climbed after President Trump voiced optimism about a trade deal with China, overshadowing some of the worries about political uncertainty in Washington.

title: Boris Johnson Goads Rivals to End His Rule, Call New Election
summary: Opposition lawmakers fear that an election campaign when Parliament isn't sitting could lead to Britain leaving the EU by default next month. LONDON-British Prime Minister Boris Johnson returned defiantly to a reconvened Parliament Wednesday following a momentous court decision that he had suspended it illegally, urging opposition parties to pass a no-confidence motion in his own government and spur an election.

title: Boeing Centralizes Control of Engineering, Safety
summary: CEO Dennis Muilenburg will play more direct role following review prompted by 737 MAX crashes. Boeing Co. Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg will gain greater control over the aerospace giant's engineering, safety and certification practices as part of a restructuring following two deadly crashes of its 737 MAX airliners.

title: FTC Sues Match for Allegedly Tricking Users With Fake Ads
summary: Online-dating platform allegedly offered certain guarantees but failed to provide promised services. The Federal Trade Commission has sued online-dating service Match Group Inc. for allegedly using fake love-interest advertisements to trick hundreds of thousands of users into buying subscriptions on Match.com.

title: An Unimpeachable Reason to Buy Stocks
summary: New tensions in Washington could be good news for big pharma. News of an impeachment inquiry against President Trump has a silver lining, according to one analyst.

title: Duly Noted
summary: John Milton's annotations of Shakespeare's First Folio are just the latest example of how fascinating marginalia can be..

title: FDA's Acting Chief Says Agency Acted Too Slowly to Avoid Vaping Crisis
summary: His comments come amid criticism from lawmakers, state health officials. WASHINGTON-The Food and Drug Administration's acting commissioner said that the agency moved too slowly to avoid the vaping health crisis, which has been linked to hundreds of lung injuries and some deaths.

title: Iranian President Spurns Talks as Long as U.S. Sanctions Are in Place
summary: In address at U.N., Hassan Rouhani assails U.S. but signals conditional openness to broader deal. UNITED NATIONS-Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said his country would engage in no new negotiations with the U.S. until Washington lifted its punishing economic sanctions, while signaling that Tehran was open to a new, broader deal if that condition were met.

title: A Seaside Haven That's Infinitely Better in the Off Season
summary: Bodrum, the fashionable escape on Turkey's Aegean Coast, slows down come fall. And that's when the savviest travelers know to visit. A tall blond man in a small blue bathing suit padded down the teak jetty of the Hotel Macakizi and lay down on the sun bed next to me. He had the bronze glow of a man who enjoyed his summer and probably didn't spend too much of it in an office. He scooted to the edge of his bed and dipped a toe in the water. The sea was warm, even in October. "Imagine, this is their off-season," he said.

title: Fresh Worries About Excess Supply Drive Down Oil
summary: Crude stockpiles rose by 2.4 million barrels last week; natural-gas futures drop for the seventh consecutive session. Oil prices fell after weekly government data showed a second consecutive increase in stockpiles, highlighting investors' anxiety about excess supply.

title: Impeachment Could Derail U.S.-Mexico-Canada Trade Deal
summary: Democrats have expressed openness to approving USMCA this year if concerns from labor groups are addressed. WASHINGTON-President Trump cast doubt on getting a congressional vote on his reworked trade deal with Mexico and Canada, citing Democrats' push for impeachment.

title: New York's Retail Vacancy Rate Climbs
summary: Vacancies rose across city but most dramatically in outer boroughs with suburban-style shopping malls. In a city where every square foot counts, more retail spaces are being left vacant as online shopping and rising rents pressure shopkeepers, an analysis by the city comptroller's office found.

title: New York City Employers Who Say 'Go Back to Your Country' Could Face Fines
summary: New guidelines specify what threats against undocumented immigrants violate law. New York City's Commission on Human Rights could seek fines of up to $250,000 against landlords and employers who threaten to call federal agents on undocumented immigrants or say "go back to your country" to someone.

title: WHO Seeks Answers on Suspected Ebola in Tanzania
summary: East African nation denies disease has reached country as health agency details possible cases. KAMPALA, Uganda-More than a year into a deadly Ebola epidemic in Congo, international public-health officials suspect the government of neighboring Tanzania is hiding a spate of cases of the virus.

title: Billionaire Behind Rockstar Energy Drink Selling Florida Homes for $71.5 Million
summary: Russell Weiner is listing two properties in Miami Beach and Delray Beach. Russell Weiner, the billionaire creator of Rockstar Energy Drink, is looking to cash in on two of his Florida homes to the tune of $71.5 million.

summary: The autumn charms of Turkey's Aegean coast. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: What Trump Said on the Ukraine Call
summary: Key exchanges in the president's July phone call with the Ukrainian leader. In key moments from a July phone call between President Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart, Mr. Trump highlighted the aid that Washington provides to Kyiv while also asking Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to "look into" Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden and his son.

title: KKR Has Quietly Built an Investment-Banking Contender
summary: Private-equity firm has grown its capital-markets business, including a signature role on Endeavor's IPO. Private-equity firm KKR & Co. has long been one of the biggest customers of Wall Street banks. Now it is keeping a larger piece of that business for itself and moving further onto some banks' turf.

title: Customers, Dealers Start to Feel Pinch of GM Strike
summary: Service departments scramble to complete repairs and maintenance as strike causes parts shortage. As the United Auto Workers strike at General Motors Co. extends to a second week, many customers taking their cars to GM dealerships for servicing are having to wait longer than usual.

title: IMF Approves Bulgaria's Georgieva as New Chief
summary: Takes over from Christine Lagarde on Oct. 1. WASHINGTON-The International Monetary Fund formally approved Bulgarian economist Kristalina Georgieva to be its next leader.

title: EBay Split Is Still No Easy Sale
summary: Surprise CEO departure removes an obstacle for radical change, but core business still slowing. Splitting up eBay further just got a little easier. But only a little.

title: Austin Butts Heads With Texas Leaders Over Abortion Funding
summary: After state law bans direct funding, city becomes first in nation to fund ancillary support for abortion. The city of Austin is caught in a political and legal feud with Texas Republicans over what constitutes public support for abortion, in the latest clash between the state's conservative leaders and its overwhelmingly liberal capital.

title: 'Why Are You Doing This to Me?' Outraged Kids Start School Early While Teens Sleep
summary: Resume Subscription. Middle-school student Maria Pekarsky wakes up by 5:30 a.m. for school, knowing her older teen brother and sister are still sound asleep with about another hour of shut-eye to go.

title: Staying Together by Living Apart: Readers Respond
summary: A Journal article on how couples in the second half of life are rewriting the terms of their relationships spurred readers to tell their own stories. How do you maintain a healthy, loving relationship with your partner? For these Wall Street Journal readers, the answer is living separately. Hundreds of readers responded to a recent article in the Journal by Clare Ansberry on how more couples in the second half of life are choosing this arrangement. While their reasons and routines varied, one common thread ran through their stories: It works for them and makes them happy. Here is a sampling of reader responses:

title: Penthouse Pair Asking $59 Million Each at Hudson Yards Megaproject
summary: The two condos at 35 Hudson Yards are coming online amid criticism of the developer's relationship with President Trump and an oversupply in the luxury market. A pair of sprawling penthouses at Hudson Yards, New York's ambitious West Side rail yards project, are listing for $59 million each.

title: Investors Sift Ashes of Marlboro Merger for Answers
summary: Unsuccessful deal talks between Altria and Philip Morris have raised doubts about the tobacco giants' strategies. Tobacco investors can breathe easier now that Altria Group and Philip Morris International have abandoned their plans to combine. But shareholders will still look for reasons why the unpopular deal was ever considered.

title: Can Porsche Beat Tesla With Its New Taycan EV?
summary: With its breakneck speed and high-tech luxury, Porsche's all-electric Taycan could spell doom for internal-combustion engines, says Dan Neil. But it might not be the best EV on the market. THE NEW PORSCHE Taycan illustrates why internal-combustion is doomed. I mean, even setting aside the fact that the rest of the world and most of the major car makers are committed to electrification by about 2030 in an effort to fight climate change-they agree on that, too. And ignoring the $91 billion commitment by Volkswagen Group announced in 2018, including billions for charging infrastructure in the U.S. And absolutely turning a blind eye to China's air-quality emergency, which has prompted the world's most populous nation and largest car market to mandate vehicle electrification. Ditto for many of the Earth's largest cities. Don't even look at those market forces.

title: Thyssenkrupp Board Seeks to Oust CEO in Renewed Upheaval
summary: German industrial company faces another shake-up amid slump in sales and profit. BERLIN- Thyssenkrupp AG's directors moved to oust the company's chief executive 14 months after he took the job, marking the latest effort to pull the industrial conglomerate out of years of slowing sales, shrinking profit and indecision over strategy.

title: Judge Blocks Subpoena of Trump Tax Returns-for One Day
summary: Subpoena is part of state prosecutors' probe into how, and whether, the Trump Organization recorded hush-money payments. NEW YORK-A federal judge on Wednesday blocked the enforcement of a subpoena for President Trump's tax returns for a single day after a contentious hearing over state prosecutors' request for his financial information.

title: Q&A With AT&T's John Stankey on Streaming Strategy
summary: Media boss discusses plans for HBO Max and integrating Time Warner. John Stankey, the chief operating officer of AT&T Inc., predicts the criticism the company is facing over its media strategy will fade away once it launches a new streaming-video product next year.

title: Senate Again Passes Resolution to Block Funding for Border Wall
summary: Trump expected to again veto measure to cancel national emergency. WASHINGTON-The Senate moved to prevent President Trump from redirecting military funds toward a border wall, voting to once again cancel Mr. Trump's emergency declaration at the border by approving a resolution that likely faces another White House veto.

title: Cost of Employer-Provided Health Coverage Passes $20,000 a Year
summary: Annual poll of employers by Kaiser Family Foundation finds premiums rose 5% for family plans; 'It's the cost of buying an economy car'. The average total cost of employer-provided health coverage passed $20,000 for a family plan this year, according to a new survey, a landmark that will likely resonate politically as health care has become an early focus of the presidential campaign.

title: Norwegian Air's Exit Leads to Passenger Drop at Stewart Airport Near New York City
summary: Port Authority to strike deal with French airport operator in bid to revive facility's fortunes. New York Stewart International Airport-60 miles north of New York City-plans to team up with a French company in a bid to lure back the international flights that fueled a now-fading passenger boom at the Hudson Valley facility.

title: Attacks on Oil Facilities Threaten Fragile Saudi Economy
summary: Kingdom, which earns two-thirds of its revenue from crude sales, lost half its production at a time when foreign investment was down and consumers suffered from low prices. JEDDAH, Saudi Arabia-The attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities delivered a shock to the kingdom at a moment of economic fragility, with its attempts to jump-start nonoil industries struggling and foreign investment down.

title: Former Head of Danske Bank's Estonian Branch Found Dead
summary: Aivar Rehe headed the bank's Estonian branch during the time it allegedly laundered $230 billion. An executive who led the bank branch at the center of a $230 billion money-laundering scandal in Estonia has been found dead in a suspected suicide.

title: Sharp Questions Can Help Boards Oversee Cybersecurity
summary: Directors should ask for details and metrics, especially when dealing with emerging technology such as AI, governance experts say. WASHINGTON-Corporate directors say they are more informed about cybersecurity risks than they were a few years ago but they might not be taking the right steps to verify what they hear from senior executives, according to governance experts.

title: Juul CEO Exits; Altria, Philip Morris End Merger Talks in Vaping Fallout
summary: E-cigarette maker Juul faces a potentially crippling U.S. ban on most of its products. The chief executive of e-cigarette startup Juul Labs Inc. abruptly stepped down on Wednesday, as U.S. efforts to combat underage vaping threaten to upend the trendy alternative to smoking.

title: Another Shocker From China's 'Tesla Killer'
summary: Chinese electric vehicle maker NIO is losing money on every car it sells and will soon need to raise more cash. China's answer to Tesla is in the breakdown lane.

title: The New TV Comedies Trade Jokes for Existential Inquiries
summary: As content overload pushes shows to stand out with novel ideas, the half-hour TV format has become a vehicle for deep questions and ambitious storytelling. "Seinfeld" was famously about nothing. Today's most innovative half-hour shows are about everything: What does it all mean? Why are we here? What comes after death?

title: Chief Justice Defends Supreme Court Against Partisan Criticism
summary: Results of cases show Justices Gorsuch, Kavanaugh don't "march in lockstep," he says. NEW YORK-Chief Justice John Roberts rejected criticism of the Supreme Court as a political body, pointing to disagreements between President Trump's two appointees as evidence that the justices do not always toe a party line.

title: With Its Party in a Box, the 'Rent the Runway of Tablescaping' Arrives
summary: Backed by a who's who of female investors, like Gwyneth Paltrow and Whitney Wolfe Herd, start-up Social Studies will ship props for a pop-up brunch to your door-Instagram-ready succulents included. Imagine if Cinderella had gone to the ball-and not only did her carriage turn into a pumpkin at midnight, but the rest of the party's canapé plates, champagne coupes and wadded-up linen napkins did too? That's pretty much the premise of entertaining start-up Social Studies, a tabletop-rental service launching this week that provides everything but the food for gatherings from four to 100 guests.

title: Discovery and Amazon Serve Up New Cooking App
summary: Food Network Kitchen will let users take classes with celebrity chefs, order ingredients through food-delivery services. Discovery Inc. is looking to generate more revenue from its stable of celebrity chefs--and help Amazon.com Inc. sell more groceries in the process.

title: Why Argentina Faces an Economic Crisis. Again.

title: The Solution to an Unsightly View? Good Design
summary: An unwelcome sight on a neighboring lot didn't stop this Belgian couple from building a 6,900-square-foot villa just east of Brussels. It offered green views, southern exposures and easy access to the Belgian capital, but came with a potential deal breaker-an unsightly trucking company right next door.

summary: Positions pared in tech stocks, Treasurys and other assets that have generated big returns. U.S. stocks' September assault on record levels is prompting many investors to shift toward assets that have lagged behind in recent years, the latest bet that value strategies will regain favor.

title: China Taps Its Private Sector to Boost Military, Raising Alarms
summary: Western firms risk unwittingly helping China's defense buildup, report says. Beijing is increasingly tapping private Chinese firms to acquire foreign technology for its military, according to officials and a new report, in a strategy that is prompting calls by leaders in Washington to retool U.S. national security policy.

title: Fired Mitsubishi Trader Denies Making Unauthorized Trades
summary: Japanese trading house says trader was responsible for $320 million in losses at subsidiary. title: Google Refuses to Pay for News Links in France
summary: Search giant will show only headlines in news results unless publishers waive license fees for previews and images. title: Santander Takes $1.7 Billion Charge on U.K. Business Amid Brexit Uncertainty

title: Macron Tried to Broker Meeting Between Trump, Iran's President
summary: Diplomatic maneuvers failed when Tehran insisted Washington commit to easing sanctions. title: China's Foreign Minister Warns of 'Endless Troubles' If U.S. and China Decouple

summary: Insurers temporarily suspend tie-up plans amid revelations about executive's arrest. summary: Conviction of former business partner to Mike Flynn overturned; investigation of Tony Podesta, Vin Weber closed. title: Globalfoundries Firming Up IPO Plans

summary: 'It will obviously have a chilling effect,' said Richard Haass, president of the Council on Foreign Relations. title: Plácido Domingo Steps Down at the Metropolitan Opera
summary: One of the world's most celebrated tenors disputes recent sexual-misconduct allegations. Plácido Domingo, one of the world's most celebrated opera stars, has withdrawn from all future performances at the Metropolitan Opera, the company said on Tuesday.
